cab.content: HIS document IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT. CABINET. ^ Memorandum by the Minister of Labour. Shipbuilding Dispute.33CRET (Previous Papers CP. 5810. CP.5856)*CP. *" " ..........5866. Following the breakdown of negotiations the Central Board of the Shipbuilding Employers'Federation met on the 20th March and decided that they would adhere to their proposal that the war bonus should be reduced by lC/6d as from the 29th March and by a further 6/- as from 6th April, 1922. notices to this effect will be posted in the yards tomorrow, 22nd March, The notice will be in the usual form announcing an alteration in the rates of wages. I have seen officials of the trade unions concerned. They have under consideration the question of taking a ballot on the employers1 proposals and will probably call a delegate Conference on Thursday, 23rd March, for the purpose of a decision. In the meantime I am keeping in close touch with both sides, (Initialled) T.J.M. 21st March, 1922,
